channel.title: 10 Push-Up-A-Post Challenge
channel.description:
Well there use to be a thread on this in the general discussion section but it's long since died and lost it's way into the back of the forums now so I've decided to bring it back to the community as I see it as a positive influence on everyone here to get active and get healthy (Do I sound like cartoon network?)
Basically here's how this works, for every post you make you must do 10 manly push ups. This rules apply's to making a topic and posting on a topic in any section of the website, for example after I post this I'm going to have to do 10 push ups. Those are the only rules for this challenge I really see necessary at the moment however you can add your own if you feel the need for that extra burn such as when editing a topic you can do 10 push ups or you can do push ups for your previous posts aswell (which if you're an average member of the website you'll be a regular body builder in no time!).
If you support the 10 Push-Up-A-Post Challenge then put this picture link in your signature (right click copy image url), although even if you're still participating in the challenge you don't have to put it there if you don't want too. [img]http://i1012.photobucket.com/albums/af242/A-SkyfiOriginal/10PostChM2105.png[/img]

item.title: 10 Push-Up-A-Post Challenge
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“5 1, post:46, topic:432418”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=535131.msg3912180#msg3912180 date=1328846270]
By the way, working out is only about 20% of loosing weight, it’s most in your diet.
[/quote]
Actually 100% not true.

Junior year in Highschool I weighed 230 and I was bored and said fuck it im’a lose 30 pounds, I ended up losing 50 pounds in 1 month. Guess how I did it?

Ran over 5 miles a day + football conditioning + football practice. Worked out also for an hr each day. Guess what my “diet” was.

I drank about 4 litters of Pepsi a day(uMad?) and ate 1 meal…

So no, what you said is 100% false. Working out is 90% of losing weight.[/quote]

Lol, 4 liters of pepsi a day is disgusting, along with 1 meal is suicide for your body nutrient wise. You said you ran 5 miles a day, you know where you lost your weight? You lost muscle along with fat. You might have lost weight but you were definetly not healthy. Your body needs 3 square meals, 4 or 5 if you do what you were doing, 5 miles + football conditioning.

You had football conditioning and football practice? Lol, how does that happen?

Read full topic

item.title: 10 Push-Up-A-Post Challenge
item.description:
@5_1 wrote:

JavaTC:

By the way, working out is only about 20% of loosing weight, it’s most in your diet.

Actually 100% not true.

Junior year in Highschool I weighed 230 and I was bored and said fuck it im’a lose 30 pounds, I ended up losing 50 pounds in 1 month. Guess how I did it?

Ran over 5 miles a day + football conditioning + football practice. Worked out also for an hr each day. Guess what my “diet” was.

I drank about 4 litters of Pepsi a day(uMad?) and ate 1 meal…

So no, what you said is 100% false. Working out is 90% of losing weight.

Read full topic

item.title: 10 Push-Up-A-Post Challenge
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:29, topic:432418”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=535131.msg3912618#msg3912618 date=1328903663]

Yeah I think I’m going to try and participate in a different way. It should be 10 push-ups for every post we’ve made on the forum up to this point, over the next year. They can be distributed any way one would like.

Let’s see, I’d need to do an average of about 16 push-ups per day, based on a sample of 5,856 posts * 10 push-ups per post over 366 days (due to leap year). That’s not bad at all.

20 at night and 20 in the morning and they become very easy.
[/quote]

Yeah, a few winters ago I did push-ups and crunches every other day, doing more and more. Was too hard to continue. But comparatively, this should be far easier.[/quote]

Nice, I myself have never been able to do an insane amount. So 10 push ups.

Read full topic

Let’s see, I’d need to do an average of about 16 push-ups per day, based on a sample of 5,856 posts * 10 push-ups per post over 366 days (due to leap year). That’s not bad at all.
[/quote]
20 at night and 20 in the morning and they become very easy.[/quote]

yes
